page.title: 02Dunston Hall Historic House
page.content: Dunston Hall, a country house of 17th century origin, situated in 4 acres of land to the north of Chesterfield. It was bought by Richard Milnes, Mayor in 1626, & still in the family in 1809. In 1670 it is described as comfortable & well furnished wtih many tables, chairs, chests & elaborate beds. The adjacent farm provided most of the food & fifty acres of hay & corn grew in the fields around. The Hall was purchased in 1978 by Mr. and Mrs. J.E. Parkinson. The west wing which had been burnt down many years before has been rebuilt by them. Also the Cruck Barn has been renovated and is now used as business offices. In 1985 the house is occupied by Mr. and Mrs. Parkinson with their four children and two grandparents.
